docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, July 1. -- The Chaco peace conference was inaugurated this afternoon by President Agustin F. Justo of Argentina. It immediately prolonged the present truce until such time as the Bolivian and Paraguayan armies are reduced to a maximum...
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, July 1. -- The Chaco peace conference was inaugurated this afternoon by President Agustin F. Justo of Argentina. It immediately prolonged the present truce until such time as the Bolivian and Paraguayan armies are reduced to a maximum strength of 5,000 effectives.

headline.main: CHACO WAR TRUCE EXTENDED SINE DIE; Action Is Conferees' First as Peace Conference Opens at Buenos Aires.

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, July 3. -- Demobilization of the Bolivian and Paraguayan armies in the Chaco began this morning under the supervision of the neutral military mission. The peace protocol provides that within ninety days from today both armies shall be...
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, July 3. -- Demobilization of the Bolivian and Paraguayan armies in the Chaco began this morning under the supervision of the neutral military mission. The peace protocol provides that within ninety days from today both armies shall be reduced to 5,000 effectives.
docs.abstract: demobilization of armies begins; 5,000 men on each side to remain

headline.main: DEMOBILIZING BEGUN BY ARMIES IN CHACO; Many Former Soldiers Are Sent on Way Home -- 5,000 Men on Each Side to Remain.

byline.original: Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, July 6. -- Continued improvement in British industry and trade, with employment rising to a new high level and widespread activity in construction lines, was reported today in the Commerce Department's weekly survey of business in our...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, July 6. -- Continued improvement in British industry and trade, with employment rising to a new high level and widespread activity in construction lines, was reported today in the Commerce Department's weekly survey of business in our foreign markets.

headline.main: FOREIGN MARKETS LED BY THE BRITISH; Washington Survey Shows Fresh Business Gains, Jobs at New Peak.

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: Except for an upturn in sterling and the Scandinavians, the trend in the other European exchanges was lower last week. Business was on a moderately heavy scale, allowing for our holiday on Thursday.
docs.lead_paragraph: Except for an upturn in sterling and the Scandinavians, the trend in the other European exchanges was lower last week. Business was on a moderately heavy scale, allowing for our holiday on Thursday.

headline.main: FOREIGN EXCHANGE RATES; WEEK ENDED JULY 6, 1935.

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, July 9. -- Two persons are dead and 200 injured, many seriously, as a result of a terrific gale that swept this city last night causing property damage estimated at several million dollars.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, July 9. -- Two persons are dead and 200 injured, many seriously, as a result of a terrific gale that swept this city last night causing property damage estimated at several million dollars.

headline.main: GALE IN MONTEVIDEO KILLS 2, INJURES 200; Great Property Damage Caused by Storm -- Rain, Snow and 2-Inch Hailstones Fall.
